body:
Into the spider-verse

Wow I’m lost for words at how amazing that movie was! The Easter eggs in it were amazing. That Stan lee cameo tho 👌 perfect. That first end credits was perfect yet so emotional at the same time

That last end credits is bloody hilarious 10/10 👌

Would I watch it again? HELL YEAH I WOULD!

You should totally go see it!

summary: “Man, wonder if that kid I used to bully knows how much it hurt when he retaliated (by pointing out I lacked the qualities I...
body:
“Man, wonder if that kid I used to bully knows how much it hurt when he retaliated (by pointing out I lacked the qualities I criticized about him)”

Listen, I love Flash, and, although they haven’t established his abusive father yet, I understand he had his own problems going on which led him to act as he did, but this is really too much. Not so much that he thinks this, since he’s shown that he doesn’t think of what he did to Peter as bullying and that, what he did, Peter asked for. It’s more that this idea of Peter being to blame for how he was treated in school that keeps being pushed whenever his high school life comes up that annoys me, because the narrative supports this.

reblog.comment:

It’s more that this idea of Peter being to blame for how he was treated in school that keeps being pushed whenever his high school life comes up that annoys me, because the narrative supports this.

It’s more that this idea of Peter being to blame for how he was treated in school that keeps being pushed whenever his high school life comes up that annoys me, because the narrative supports this.

Not so much that he thinks this, since he’s shown that he doesn’t think of what he did to Peter as bullying and that, what he did, Peter asked for. It’s more that this idea of Peter being to blame for how he was treated in school that keeps being pushed whenever his high school life comes up that annoys me, because the narrative supports this.

summary: Marvel's Spider-Man: Silver Lining DLC Trailer
title: Marvel's Spider-Man: Silver Lining DLC Trailer
body:
The next DLC trailer to #Marvel’s #SpiderMan #PS4 game is out now.

After the events of the previous DLC involving the battle between two of New York’s crime family, Silver Saber comes back after finding out that Hammerhead has stolen her tech to cause havok in the city.  


In the tension-filled finale to Marvel’s Spider-Man: The City That Never Sleeps, the web-slinger must rely on unlikely…

View On WordPress

tags: Spider Man Into the Spider Verse
summary:
Marvel’s Spider-Man for PS4 - DLC 3: Silver Lining teaser.  key visual by Adi Granov 

Into the Spider-Verse Suit, Cyborg...
caption:
Marvel’s Spider-Man for PS4 - DLC 3: Silver Lining teaser.

key visual by Adi Granov

Into the Spider-Verse Suit, Cyborg Spider-Man Suit, and Aaron Aikman Armor Suit 

Silver Sable has stormed back to reclaim her stolen Sable International tech. With New York Police Chief Yuri Watanabe on administrative leave following her exploits against Hammerhead, Spider-Man will have to rely on unlikely allies to keep Marvel’s New York safe.

Marvel’s Spider-Man: Silver Lining features new missions, new and upgraded enemy and crime types, along with upgraded Hammerhead bases and storyline quests. There will also be new trophies, challenges, and three new suits for players to unlock.

We’re also very excited to be partnering with Sony Pictures on the upcoming film Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse, in theaters December 14. We are offering a special promotion where users who pre-order the Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse film from PlayStation Store will receive a voucher for Marvel’s Spider-Man: Silver Lining, a dynamic theme, and avatars as their pre-order incentive. As you may have seen at the end of our teaser trailer, we have included Peter Parker’s suit from the movie into our third DLC chapter. Pre-orders for the movie officially start tomorrow and then you’ll be able to unlock and swing around in the film’s version of Peter Parker’s suit once Marvel’s Spider-Man: Silver Lining launches on December 21!

It was a real pleasure working in partnership with Sony Pictures and Marvel to bring this suit to the game — and we can’t wait to see what you do in photo mode with it! You’ll also be able to unlock the Cyborg Spider-Man suit and the Aaron Aikman Spider-Armor.

“Silver Lining” releases on December 21. The add-on will cost $9.99 individually, and is also part of the $24.99 “The City That Never Sleeps” downloadable content series, which contains the previously released “The Heist” and “Turf Wars”.

tags: sorry if this is too on-spot
body:
Tumblr predictions 2019

  • Staff realizes that their flagging system doesn’t work and bans all images in response
  • People make images out of text in retaliation
  • Gifs will be banned as well, and people will make their text images slowly move, and if you quickly scroll down the page, it will look like it’s moving
  • More Voltron discourse
  • Actual Lucky Luciano gets a Tumblr
  • Lucky Luciano gets arrested again
  • Kim Possible fandom will rise from the ashes
  • Kim Possible fandom will feud over whether the movie is gonna be trash or not
  • People revert to fifth grade (spelling things with calculators, making that s thing, etc.)
  • Everyone loves Spider-Man
  • John Mulaney memes in light of his part in Into the Spider-Verse
  • Jokes about Iron Man’s death, even if he doesn’t die
  • 4chan trolls will try to invade Tumblr again and there will be a mass movement against them
  • Great Migration memes
  • Memes about Tumblr being empty
  • Posts that are literally just spaces
  • New glitch. Messages go to the wrong person

blog.name: greatrunner
blog.title: Give my Regards to the Inferno!
blog.description:
greatrunner | 30 | Sagittarius | Writer. | Professional Heel. | Formerly everyleaffallstoosoon and vemeer-mark-iv | banner: ironmacn

Hello, strange wanderer of the tumblrsphere of danger. This is a blogsphere for my personal likes and interests. If you're interested in what I happen to be interested in, check out my archive, tags and navigation. This is not a spoiler free zone, I usually don't mark spoilers. This blog contains blood, gore and body horror. Basically it contains content that isn’t for thirteen and under audiences, so please don’t follow me if you aren’t 18+. Thanks for visiting, tho.
